text: Which of the following settlement type is the largest?
explanation: Megalopolis is the largest settlement type, referring to a vast urban complex formed by the coalescence of multiple cities.

text: The location of iron and steel industry at Ajakuta in Nigeria is best explained by the presence of (1) iron ore at Itakpe (11) limestone at Ewekoro (III) river port at Lokoja (IV) coal at Orukpa and Okaba
explanation: The location of the iron and steel industry at Ajaokuta in Nigeria is best explained by the presence of iron ore at Itakpe and limestone at Ewekoro.

text: One characteristic that distinguishes urban settlements from rural settlements is that

options.A: rural settlements are areas of secondary activities
options.B: urban settlements are areas of primary activities
options.C: urban settlements are areas of secondary and tertiary activities
options.D: both primary and tertiary activities predominate in urban settlement

explanation: Urban settlements are distinguished from rural settlements by being areas of secondary and tertiary activities. Urban areas are typically centers of commerce, industry, and services, while rural areas are primarily focused on agriculture and primary activities

text: A major problem in agricultural development in Nigeria is

options.A: the application of fertilizer instead of manure

explanation: A major problem in agricultural development in Nigeria is insufficient storage facilities, which can lead to post-harvest losses.

text: They are formed in layers and derived from old rocks and the remains of dead organic materials. This description refers
explanation: The description refers to sedimentary rocks. Sedimentary rocks are formed in layers and derived from old rocks and the remains of dead organic materials.

text: Which of the following geographical regions of Nigeria covers one-fifth of the country and has a generally flat surface dotted with granitic hills? The
explanation: The Cross River Basin covers one-fifth of Nigeria and has a generally flat surface dotted with granitic hills.

text: The solar system comprises the sun and
explanation: The solar system comprises the sun and eight planets (Mercury, Mars, Venus, Earth, Neptune, Uranus, Saturn, and Jupiter).

text: On June 21st, when the sun is overhead at the Tropic of Cancer,places in the Northern Hemisphere experience
explanation: longer day and shorter night. On June 21st, the sun is overhead at the Tropic of Cancer (23.5°N latitude), which marks the summer solstic in the Northern Hemisphere. As a result, places in the Northern Hemisphere experience:Longer days (more daylight hours)Shorter nights (fewer darkness hours)This is because the North Pole is tilted towards the sun, causing the sun to appear higher in the sky and remain visible for a longer period

text: Which of the following least influences population density in Nigeria?
explanation: Mining least influences population density in Nigeria. While mining can lead to an influx of people into mining areas, it does not have a significant impact on population density in Nigeria as a whole.

text: Which of the following countries is located within the Horn of Africa?
explanation: Djibouti is a country located within the Horn of Africa. The Horn of Africa refers to the peninsula in Eastern Africa that juts out into the Arabian Sea, and includes countries such as Djibouti, Eritrea, Ethiopia, and Somalia. Swaziland is a landlocked country in Southern Africa Chad is a landlocked country in Central Africa, Kenya is a country in East Africa, and Libya is a country in North Africa, but none of these countries are located within the Horn of Africa.

text: Which of the following climatic types is found on the western margins of continents between altitude 300 and 400 North and South of the Equator?
explanation: The Mediterranean climatic type is found on the western margins of continents between latitudes 30° and 40° North and South of the Equator.

text: Which of the following is not a sea route?
explanation: London-Moscow-Baghdad is not a sea route, as it passes through landlocked cities

text: Which of the following best explains why wind action is more predominant in Arid regions than in Humid regions?

options.A: Lack of surface drainage and the presence of strong winds
options.B: Excessively high temperature during the day and night
options.C: Loose surface materials and the absence of vegetation cover

explanation: Wind action is more predominant in arid regions than in humid regions because of loose surface materials and the absence of vegetation cover. In arid regions, the lack of vegetation and loose surface materials allow wind to easily pick up and transport particles.

text: Cement factory is usually located near
explanation: Cement factories are usually located near sources of raw materials, such as limestone and clay.

text: Mountains formed as a result of compressional forces in the earth's crust are
explanation: Mountains formed as a result of compressional forces in the earth's crust are fold mountains. Fold mountains are formed when the earth's crust is compressed and folded, resulting in the formation of mountains.

text: All the following are causes of mechanical weathering except
explanation: Rain action is not a cause of mechanical weathering. Mechanical weathering is the breakdown of rocks into smaller particles through physical forces such as temperature changes, frost action, and the action of plants and animals.

text: Which of the following regions in Nigeria has an average height of over 100 metres above sea level?
explanation: The Biu Plateau has an average height of over 100 meters above sea level. The Biu Plateau is a region of high ground in northeastern Nigeria

text: Which of the following dams in Africa provides both irrigation water and hydro-electricity?
explanation: The Akosombo Dam in Ghana provides both irrigation water and hydro-electricity. The dam was built on the Volta River and provides hydro-electric power and irrigation water for agriculture.

text: A conurbation is a settlement

options.B: where a large number of town join together over a considerable area
options.C: in which two or more towns have joined together with each retaining its identity

explanation: A conurbation is a settlement where a large number of towns join together over a considerable area.

text: All the major industrial zones of Nigeria owe their origin mainly to
explanation: All the major industrial zones of Nigeria owe their origin mainly to the abundance of water resources, which provides hydroelectric power and water supply for industries

text: Temperatures of adjacent coastlands are reduced when on - shore winds blow over cold currents because the

options.A: current increases the total rainfall in such areas
options.B: current influences the temperature of the prevailing winds
options.C: rainfall in sunny areas is usually heavy

explanation: Temperatures of adjacent coastlands are reduced when on-shore winds blow over cold currents because the current influences the temperature of the prevailing winds. When on-shore winds blow over cold currents, they bring cooler air to the coast, reducing temperatures.

text: When the sun is directly overhead at the tropic of Capricorn (23 %, °) on 22nd December, the Northern Hemisphere experiences it's
explanation: When the sun is directly overhead at the tropic of Capricorn (23° 20′) on December 22nd, the Northern Hemisphere experiences winter solstice. This occurs when the North Pole is tilted away from the sun, resulting in the shortest day of the year.

text: Which of the following rock types is coal associated with?
explanation: Coal is associated with organically-formed sedimentary rocks. Coal is formed from the remains of plants that have been buried for millions of years.

text: A large expanse of low, level land, formed due to an uplift of part of the sea floor bordering a continent is called
explanation: A large expanse of low, level land formed due to an uplift of part of the sea floor bordering a continent is called a coastal plain. Coastal plain are formed when the sea floor is uplifted and exposed, creating a flat or gently sloping area.

text: Which of the following are best explains the drift of population from rural to the cities in Nigeria?

options.A: There is food scarcity in the rural areas
options.B: There are more job opportunities in the cities
options.C: Better recreational facilities are available in the cities
options.D: The cost of living in the cities is very high

explanation: The drift of population from rural to urban areas in Nigeria is best explained by the availability of more job opportunities in the cities. Man people move from rural areas to cities in search of better job opportunities and higher living standards.

text: Which of the following best accounts for the decline in the importance of rail transport in Africa?

options.A: Low volume of goods available for transportation
options.D: Threat of retrenchment of railway workers

explanation: The decline in the importance of rail transport in Africa is best accounted for by high competition from road transport. In many African countries, roads have been improved, making road transport a more attractive option than rail transport.

text: If the local time at a place X is 12.00 noon when the G.M.T is 5.00a.m then X is located on longitude
explanation: If the local time at a place X is 12:00 noon when the GMT is 5:00 am, then X is located on longitude 75° W. This is because the local time is hours behind GMT, indicating a longitude of 75° W.

text: All the following are members of the ECOWAS except
explanation: Cameroon is not a member of ECOWAS. ECOWAS is a regional economic union of 15 West African countries, and Cameroon is not one of them.

text: Which of the following is not a proof to show that the earth is spherical in shape?
explanation: Sunrise and sunset are not proofs that the Earth is spherical in shape, as they can be observed on other celestial bodies as well.

text: Nigeria is located between longitude
explanation: Nigeria is located between longitude 3oE and 15°E.

text: The world's busiest shipping routes are on the
explanation: The world's busiest shipping routes are on the Atlantic Ocean

text: The outer layer of the earth is called the
explanation: The outer layer of the earth is called the crust. Other options are not.

text: The major problem facing the utilization of human resources in West Africa is

options.B: housing for all by the year 2000

explanation: Unemployment is a major problem facing the utilization of human resources in West Africa.

text: The development of hydro-electric power in Nigeria is least affected by the

options.B: availability of suitable sites for dams
options.C: rapid increase in demand for electricity

explanation: The development of hydro-electric power in Nigeria is least affected by the availability of suitable sites for dams. While suitable sites are necessary for building dams, other factors such as a regular supply of water and high mountains are more critical for hydro-electric power development.

text: The equatorial diameter of the earth is approximately
explanation: The equatorial diameter of the earth is approximately 6,760 km. This is the distance from the equator to the equator, passing through the center of the earth.

text: All the following are advantages of the bush fallowing system in West Africa except that it

options.A: is very economical in the use of land
options.B: reduces the need for the use of artificial fertilizers
options.C: allows land to regain its fertility during fallow

explanation: The bush fallowing system in West Africa is not very economical in the use of land. Bush fallowing involves leaving land fallow for several years to regain its fertility, which can lead to inefficient use of land.

text: The tourist centre of Ogbunike cave is located near
explanation: The tourist centre of Ogbunike Cave is located near Onitsha in Anambra State.

text:
Which of the following is an effect of rural-urban migration on the source region?
Rural unemployment
explanation: Rural-urban migration leads to rural depopulation. When people move from rural areas to cities, it can lead to a decline in population in rural areas.

text: Which of the following is not an element of climate?
explanation: Altitude is not an element of climate, but rather a factor that influences climate.

text: Which of the following best accounts for the high population density in the Nile Valley?
explanation: The high population density in the Nile Valley is due to the presence of rich alluvial soil, which supports intensive agriculture and settlement.

text: Rocks which have been formed by the cooling and solidification of molten magma are called
explanation: Igneous rocks are formed from the cooling and solidification of molten magma

text: The climatic belts recognized by the Greek were
explanation: The ancient Greeks recognized three climatic belts: the torrid zone (near the equator), the temperate zone (in the middle latitudes), and the frigid zone (near the poles).

text: A conurbation can best be described as

options.A: two or more towns joined together, each town maintaining its own identity
options.B: a big area of land with few settlements
options.C: a large village with thousands of people
options.D: a large area with big cities

explanation: A conurbation is a term used to describe a group of cities, towns, or urban areas that have merged together to form a single urban entity, while still retaining their individual identities.

text: Sills, dykes and batholiths are examples of
explanation: Sills, dykes, and batholiths are all examples of intrusive volcanic landforms, formed when magma cools and solidifies beneath the Earth's surface

text: Which of the following is not true of pie chart?

options.A: data with wide extreme can be conveniently represented in a pie chart
options.B: statistics of various item can be represented on a single diagram
options.C: it is often difficult to compare the component parts

explanation: Pie charts are not suitable for representing data with wide extremes, as they are better suited for showing proportions and percentages.

text: Which of the following environmental hazards is due primarily to human activities?
explanation: Ozone depletion is an environmental hazard primarily caused by human activities, such as the release of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) and other ozone-depleting substances into the atmosphere.

text: Life expectancy refers to the

options.A: age at which people retire from their jobs
options.B: average age at which people die
options.C: age at which people receive their pension

explanation: Life expectancy refers to the average age at which people in a population are expected to die, based on mortality rates and other factors.

text: The most common mode of transportation in Africa is
explanation: In Africa, the most common mode of transportation is by road, as many countries have extensive road networks that connect cities, towns, and villages. While air transportation is available in some countries, it is not as widespread as road transportation. Soil is not a mode of transportation, and ocean transportation is primarily used for international trade and travel.

text: A great advantage of Basin irrigation is that

options.A: the basin helps to trap much alluvium to enrich the soil
options.B: it makes it possible to irrigate larger areas
options.C: it is an expensive means of irrigation

explanation: A great advantage of Basin irrigation is that water is not wasted, as the basin helps to trap and conserve water.

text: All the following are problems of mining in Africa except
explanation: Inadequate unskilled labor is not a problem of mining in Africa, as many Africans have the necessary skills and expertise. The other options - use of obsolete technology, inadequate foreign capital, and shortage of power - are all significant challenges facing the mining industry in Africa.

text: On June 21st, when the sun is overhead at the Tropic of Cancer,places in the Northern Hemisphere experience
explanation: On June 21st, when the Sun is overhead at the Tropic of Cancer, places in the Northern Hemisphere experience longer days and shorter nights.

text: A settlement developed at the meeting point of roads is known as a
explanation: A nodal town is a settlement that develops at the meeting point of roads, where people and goods come together to exchange goods and services. This type of town often becomes a hub of economic activity and growth.

text: 'It is a port that specializes in receiving and redistributing goods to the neighboring countries'. Which of the following ports is described in the preceding statement?
explanation: An Entrepot port is a specialized port that receives and redistributes goods to neighboring countries. It acts as a hub for international trade collecting goods from various sources and shipping them to other destinations.

text: Africa's largest timber producer is
explanation: Zaire (now the Democratic Republic of Congo) is Africa's largest timber producer.

text: A geyser is best described as/an
explanation: A geyser is a natural spring that ejects hot water and steam in a fountain-like shape, often at regular intervals.

text: A line joining places having an equal degree of cloudiness is an
explanation: An isoneph is a line joining places having an equal degree of cloudiness

text: The process of head ward erosion will lead to the formation of
explanation: Headward erosion can lead to river capture, where a river erodes its way upstream and captures the flow of another river

text: Which of the following is a fossil fuel?
explanation: Lignite is a fossil fuel, also known as brown coal

text: Which of the following lines of latitudes divides the earth into two hemispheres
explanation: The Equator divides the Earth into two hemispheres - the Northern Hemisphere and the Southern Hemisphere

text: Sunrise and sunset are not proofs that the Earth is spherical in shape, as they can be observed on other celestial bodies as well.
explanation: Mercury and Venus are the two planets that lie between the Sun and Earth.

text: The system of cultivation of tropical commercial crops estates is known as
explanation: The system of cultivation of tropical commercial crops estates is known as plantation agriculture

text: A mercury barometer is used for measuring
explanation: A mercury barometer is used to measure atmospheric pressure, which is the pressure exerted by the weight of the air in the atmosphere.

text: When a ship appears over the distant horizon the

options.A: mast is seen before the hull
options.B: hull is seen before the cabin
options.C: cabin is seen before the mast
options.D: hull and the mast are seen together

explanation: When a ship appears over the distant horizon, the mast is seen before the hull, due to the curvature of the Earth.

text: The Gezira scheme and the Manaquil Extension are famous for the cultivation of
explanation: The Gezira scheme and the Manaquil Extension are famous for the cultivation of cotton.

text: An example of an organically formed sedimentary rock is
explanation: Coal is an organically formed sedimentary rock, formed from the remains of ancient plants.

text: The ocean that connects Europe and America is the
explanation: The Atlantic Ocean connects Europe and America, separating the two continents.

text: Which activity requires the following? I. Large area of land usually in thousands of hectares II. Availability of water either in the form of rain or irrigation III. High capital outlay
explanation: Plantation agriculture requires a large area of land, usually in thousands of hectares, to cultivate crops such as coffee, tea, or cocoa. It als requires adequate water supply, either through rainfall or irrigation, and significant capital investment for equipment, labor, and infrastructure.

text: In which part of the atmosphere does rain clouds develop?
explanation: Rain clouds develop in the troposphere, the lowest layer of the atmosphere

text: Which type of rock are quartzite, schist and marble
explanation: Quartzite, schist, and marble are all examples of metamorphic rocks, formed when existing rocks are transformed by heat and pressure.

text: The nearest planet to the sun is the
explanation: Mercury is the planet closest to the sun. Other options are not.

text: The angular distance of a point on the Earth's surface measured in degrees from the centre of the Earth east or west of the Greenwich Meridian is known as
explanation: Longitude is the angular distance of a point on the Earth's surface measured in degrees from the center of the Earth east or west of the Greenwich Meridian.

text: Copper is an important raw material in the
explanation: Copper is an essential raw material in the electrical industry, used for making wires, circuits, and other electrical components.

text: Which of the following features is shared by Hong Kong, Java and Manhattan?
explanation: Hong Kong, Java, and Manhattan are all known for their high population density, with large numbers of people living in a relatively smallarea.

text: The innermost section of the Earth is the
explanation: The innermost section of the Earth is the core other options are not.

text: The part of the earth's crust that is covered by oceans and seas is called
explanation: The hydrosphere refers to the part of the Earth's crust that is covered by oceans and seas.

text: The major source of power for most terrestrial ecosystems is
explanation: Solar energy is the major source of power for most terrestrial ecosystems, as it provides the energy that drives photosynthesis in plants.

text: The term over-population is best defined as the situation where

options.B: birth rate is equal to death rate
options.C: there is an increasing birth rate and a decreasing infant mortality rate

explanation: Over-population occurs when the number of people in a given area exceeds the available resources, such as food, water, shelter, andhealthcare.

text: The longest river in Africa is River
explanation: The longest river in Africa is the Nile River other options are not

text: Which of the following is not a type of mountain?
explanation: There is no such thing as a "mountain of accumulation". The other options - conical mountain, block mountain, and fold mountain - are all types of mountains.

text: When wet and dry bulb thermometers record the same temperature, it means
explanation: When the wet and dry bulb thermometers record the same temperature, it means that the air is saturated with water vapour.
